getRequiredVars

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getRequiredVars()
Gives a list of variable names need to solve an equation. If the equation has any constants listed as NUMBERS, they will not be returned. (i.e. "Force=Mass-3" will return ["Force","Mass"])

Returns:
An arraylist of strings that correspond to the names of variables needed

hasVariable

public boolean hasVariable(java.lang.String name)
Allows the user to check if this equation can be used to solve for a particular variable

Parameters:
name - - the name of the variable the user wants to check against
Returns:
returns whether the equation can be used to solve for the variable the user wants

isVector

public boolean isVector(Figure f)
This method determines whether or not he base equation needs to do component method or not

Parameters:
Figure - f A figure is need so that it can be determined, based off figure's variables, whether component method shall be use
Returns:
if component method needs to be used

splitEquation

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> splitEquation()
Splits the current form of the equation by variables

Returns:
A String arraylist of the parts of the current equation (symbols & parentheses included)
